points.digest: If there is anything more stupid than inculcating a teenager from HPV, then it will certainly inculcate a newborn baby from hepatitis B.

Like HPV, hepatitis B is a virus that is transmitted mainly through sexual contact, or through the blood.If a mother is infected with hepatitis B, the virus can pass to the child through the placenta, or during labor. Hepatitis B does not pass through mother's milk. [[1]== https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3557270] [[2]==http://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736%2875%2990724-2/ ​​abstract]

In 80% of infected adults, the disease passes without symptoms, or with very mild symptoms, and they do not even know they were sick. After infection, they get lifelong immunity. Of the remaining 20% ​​who are diagnosed with hepatitis B, 95% completely recover, and receive lifelong immunity.
Of the remaining 5%, only 25% (ie 0.25% of all infected) will develop, 20-30 years after infection, cirrhosis or cancer. Cirrhosis or cancer develops not because of the virus itself, but because of the immune reaction to it.
70% of patients with hepatitis B are the people's commissar ana, gay, alcoholics, homeless, having many sexual partners.
In cirrhosis or in cancer, hepatitis B [goes == http: //www.mdedge.com/ccjm/article/94870/gastroenterology/hepatitis-b-virus -infection-understanding-its-epidemiology / page / 0/1? channel = 213] mainly in alcoholics, smokers, hepatitis C patients, obese and with diabetes.

Why should a newborn child be vaccinated against STDs, which he practically can not catch? Well, simply [because==http://www.nytimes.com/1991/03/01/us/us-panel-urges-that-all-children-be-vaccinated-for-hepatitis-b.html] that adult drug addicts and gay men refused to vaccinate, so it was decided to vaccinate children immediately after birth, when they are not yet able to refuse.

Three doses of the vaccine are usually given, the first immediately after birth, the second in a month, and the third at 6 months. This is the only inoculation given immediately after birth (except btszh, which is so ineffective that almost nowhere else in the world is not used.) If you think that the vaccine is given right after birth in order to prevent possible infection from the mother, then no.In the USA and in other countries all women before birth are tested for hepatitis B. Children of infected mothers receive immunoglobulin together with immunization passive vaccination). In some countries, however, vaccinate all children simply [because==http://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/0272989X9301300103] that it is much cheaper than checking all mothers.

points.title: Epidemiology of Hepatitis B in the United States
points.digest: Before the start of the universal vaccination of infants, in 1990, only 1 in 100,000 children under the age of 15 had hepatitis B in the US At the moment, the risk of contracting hepatitis B to 20 years [is==https://www.cdc.gov/hepatitis/statistics/2013surveillance/pdfs/2013hepsurveillancerpt.pdf] 0.3 per million In developed countries, hepatitis B is a rare disease, and it is more common in Africa and in Southeast Asia.

The first vaccine against hepatitis B appeared in 1981. It was made on the basis of a live virus, and after its introduction the number of hepatitis B infected rapidly [increased==http://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/pubs/ pinkbook/hepb.html.] In 1994, it was found that despite the presence of a vaccine, the number of patients with hepatitis B does not decrease.

There are many manufacturers of this vaccine, but in developed countries they use mainly Recombivax (Merck) and Engerix-B (GSK), as well as combined vaccines.
Engerix-B contains aluminum hydroxide, and Recombivax amorphous hydrogen phosphate sulfate Aluminum (AAHS, the same adjuvant that contains Gardasil.) In Recombivax aluminum is twice as large (500 micrograms vs. 250mkg). Previously, it was indicated on the Recombivax package that it contains aluminum hydroxide, and now [write== https://www.fda.gov/BiologicsBloodVaccines/Vaccines/ApprovedProducts/ucm110098.htm] as follows: 0.5 mg of aluminum is provided as an aluminum hydroxyphosphate sulfate, previously referred to as aluminum hydroxide. poll as generally can be trusted list of vaccine ingredients.
Viruses for both vaccines are grown in leaps and bounds, so contain 1% yeast protein, which may well lead to an allergy to yeast.

In most European countries, newborns are not vaccinated against hepatitis B, and they are vaccinated 2-3 months after birth.In some countries (Finland, Iceland, Denmark, Hungary) children in general [do not vaccinate==http://vaccine-schedule.ecdc.europa.eu/Pages/Scheduler.aspx] from hepatitis B, but there are no epidemics there: on the contrary, the mortality rate from hepatitis B is much [lower==http://global-disease-burden.healthgrove.com/l/27593/Hepatitis-B-in-Iceland# Impact%20in%20Similar%20Locations&s=1hHHUH] than the average for Europe.

Clinical trials of the safety of these vaccines did not have a control group at all, because it is considered extremely unethical not to vaccinate a newborn baby from STDs, which he practically can not catch.

points.title: Recombinant hepatitis B vaccine and the risk of multiple sclerosis: a prospective study.
points.digest:
Vaccinated from hepatitis B, three years after the vaccination, they had multiple sclerosis 3.1 times more often than not vaccinated.
Several other studies that did not find an increased risk of multiple sclerosis in vaccinated patients are also being analyzed [Here are==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/10470051], for example, a study that did not find an increased risk, because they used the date of diagnosis, rather than the date of the onset of the first symptoms.The diagnosis of multiple sclerosis is usually made after a few years after the onset of symptoms.

points.title: Hepatitis B vaccine and the risk of CNS inflammatory demyelination in childhood.
points.digest: The Engerix-B vaccine increased the risk of multiple sclerosis 2.77 times compared to other hepatitis B vaccines.

points.title: Evolution of multiple sclerosis in France since the beginning of hepatitis B vaccination.
points.digest: After the vaccination against hepatitis B in France, the number of cases of multiple sclerosis increased by 65%. There is a high correlation (0.93 / 0.73) between the number of vaccine doses made and the number of cases of multiple sclerosis after 1-2 years.

points.title: A case-control study of serious autoimmune adverse events following hepatitis B immunization.
points.digest: VAES analysis: Grafted from hepatitis B, adults developed multiple sclerosis 5.2 times more often than those vaccinated against tetanus. The risk of vasculitis was 2.6 times higher, alopecia 7.2 times, lupus 9 times, arthritis 2 times, rheumatoid arthritis 18 times, thrombocytopenia 2 times, inflammation of the optic nerve 14 times higher.

points.title: Adverse events associated with hepatitis B vaccine in U.S. children less than six years of age, 1993 and 1994.
points.digest: Vaccination against hepatitis B increased the risk of arthritis 5.9 times, acute otitis 1.6 times, pharyngitis 1.4 times.

points.title: Hepatitis B vaccine and liver problems in U.S. children less than 6 years old, 1993 and 1994.
points.digest: Vaccination from hepatitis B increased the risk of liver disease by 1.5-2.3 times.

points.title: Hepatitis B vaccination of male neonates and autism diagnosis, NHIS 1997-2002.
points.digest: Newborns grafted from hepatitis B had a 3-fold greater risk of developing autism, compared with the unvaccinated, or vaccinated at least one month after birth.

points.title: Autoimmune hazards of hepatitis B vaccine.
points.digest: A review article on the autoimmune consequences of vaccination against hepatitis B, and how this vaccine is combined with evidence-based medicine (in no way).

points.title: Delayed acquisition of neonatal reflexes in newborn primates receiving a thimerosal-containing hepatitis B vaccine: the impact of gestational age and birth weight.
points.digest:
Newborn macaques were vaccinated against hepatitis B with thiomersal, and compared with unvaccinated.
The grafted macaques acquired survival reflexes, as well as motor and sensory-motor reflexes much later than the unvaccinated ones. Low weight and premature birth aggravated the effect

Thiomersal (ethyl mercury) has not been added to vaccines since 2003 in the US and Western Europe, but is still used in other countries.In Canada, [for example==http://www.phac-aspc.gc.ca/publicat/ccdr-rmtc/07vol33/acs-06/index-eng.php], not to mention Russia, Eastern Europe and the Third World .

points.title: Hepatitis B triple series vaccine and developmental disability in US children aged 1-9 years.
points.digest: In vaccinated against hepatitis B, the risk of developmental delay was 9 times higher than that of the unvaccinated.

points.title: Clustering of Cases of IDDM 2 to 4 Years after Hepatitis B Immunization is Consistent with Clustering after Infections and Progression to IDDM in Autoantibody Positive Individuals.
points.digest:
After the start of the vaccination campaign, the number of children with type 1 diabetes increased in France by 61%, and in New Zealand by 48%. In Italy, hepatitis B vaccines were 40% more unvaccinated for adolescents.
The increase in the number of cases of juvenile diabetes occurs 2-4 years after the start of vaccination, which hints at a causal relationship.

points.digest:
ASIA, or Schonfeld Syndrome, is a common name for autoimmune diseases caused by adjuvants, and includes autoimmune effects of aluminum adjuvants, Gulf war syndrome, macrophage myositis (MMF), and silicones (autoimmune effects of silicone implants). neurological and psychiatric symptoms, cognitive impairment, muscle pain, arthritis, chronic fatigue, insomnia, vision problems and with the gastrointestinal tract, etc ..
93 cases associated with vaccination against hepatitis B are analyzed here.

points.digest: With immunization from hepatitis B, such autoimmune diseases as Reiter syndrome, arthritis, lupus, inflammation of the choroid, myasthenia, erythema nodosum, thrombocytopenic purpura, Evans syndrome and demyelinating diseases of the central nervous system are associated.

points.digest: The epigenetic effect of the vaccine: Mice were given one or two inoculations from hepatitis B (at the appropriate dose).
